moves.1. e4 c5 2. d4: not so popular gambit. it opens the center quickly but it leeds to a wild game with chances on both sides.
moves.2... cxd4 3. c3 dxc3 4. Nxc3 Nc6 5. Nf3: white gained an open space, a solid center and a quick piece developement. will it last?
moves.8... g6 9. Rd1 Bg4: does black see the threat? I don't think so. Bf4 and e5 are very powerful for white.
moves.10. Bf4 Nd7 11. Rac1: ? misses the tactical blow. 11. Bxf7! with Ng5  later on.
moves.11... Nce5 12. Bxe5 Bxf3 13. Bxf7+: of course. demolishes all defence around the king...
moves.13... Kxf7 14. Qxf3+ Nf6 15. Bxf6 exf6 1: ! both f6 and d6 are in danger.
moves.19... Bg7 20. Rc7+ Kf8 21. Qb3 Qxc7: it seems like the only move to prevent Qf7#.
